attributes.action: acknowlege that British voters have no confidence in the ability of many Members of Parliament (of all parties) to represent the views of ordinary people, and he needs to consult with voters, well before the next General Election, on the measures that are needed to restore that confidence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Very many voters are deeply angry with MPs because of the widespread abuse of the expenses system.
 
The majority of voters work hard, but must do without luxuries, as they struggle to survive on inadequate wages: at the moment many of us see no hope of improvement.

The realities of that sort of existence do not seem to have reached a large number of MPs. It is difficult to see how these MPs can understand the hardships for families across the country, far less represent them.

Some MPs appear to be guilty of fraud against the British people. 

Many MPs appear to have stretched the rules to an extent that indicates a total contempt for the taxpayer who has to fund their self-indulgent lifestyle.
 
Some MPs have treated the rules with integrity, but appear to have done nothing to halt the abuses by their colleagues. 

Very many of the voters of Britain have no confidence in the ability of MPs to represent them. The PM needs to consult with a wide cross-section of voters to ensure that this confidence can be restored.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
